reviews.text: On the one hand, the Hotel Restaurant Balm is a very nice hotel. We had a large, spacious double room for 168 CHF (£115, $182 USD) per night, including breakfast, plus 5 CHF city tax. reviews.title: Quiet hotel outside of Luzern

reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Balm in Meggen near Lucerne, choosing an out of town hotel in preference to a city location and definitely made the right choice. Situated about 15 minutes back from the lake with a view of Rigi, for our purposes it was much nicer to have a quieter and more picturesque location than stay in the touristy centre. It was so easy to get into the city via bus (stop right out side the hotel, every 20mins during the day) and to travel to Weggis or Rigi by car (less than 30 mins). Hotel staff incredibly friendly and helpful, and even though we didn't eat at the restaurant we had after dinner drinks and desserts at the bistro/outside terrace. Buffet breakfasts were excellent - cheese, cold meats, fresh bread, eggs, fruit, yoghurt, cereals - all fresh and copious. Rooms were clean and modern, and the lack of aircon (common to all Swiss hotels) was easily solved by opening the windows during the night (no problem as it was out of town). Hotel also has 3 bed and 4 bed rooms for families with children. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly out of town hotel near Lucerne
